skill.name: code-review-standards
skill.description: Code review framework and criteria. References security-sentinel for security checks. Use when performing code reviews or defining review standards.
skill.summary: Code review framework and criteria. References security-sentinel for security checks. Use when perfo...
skill.author: Barnhardt-Enterprises-Inc

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with review checklists and templates. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no code execution paths. Benign documentation for code review standards.

content.value_statement: Code reviews often miss issues due to inconsistent criteria. This skill provides a 4-level severity classification and comprehensive checklists covering security, TypeScript, performance, and code quality to ensure thorough reviews every time.
actual_capabilities: Apply 4-level severity classification (Critical, High, Medium, Low) to review findings
Execute security review using OWASP Top 10 checklist
Identify performance issues like N+1 queries and unnecessary re-renders
Generate structured review feedback with templates
Check code quality rules including naming, complexity, and dead code
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests
Does not access external files or repositories directly
Does not modify code or create pull requests
Relies on user to apply findings and verify fixes

use_cases.title: Review pull requests
use_cases.description: Apply consistent standards when reviewing teammate code before merge

use_cases.title: Define team standards
use_cases.description: Establish review criteria and severity levels across the engineering team

use_cases.title: Guide code reviews
use_cases.description: Provide structured review framework for AI-assisted code evaluation

prompt_templates.title: Basic review request
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this pull request using the code-review-standards skill. Classify all issues by severity (Critical, High, Medium, Low) and provide specific file locations and suggested fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a security-focused code review using the security checklist. Look for hardcoded secrets, injection risks, authentication issues, and OWASP Top 10 concerns.

prompt_templates.title: Performance audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for performance issues using the performance-criteria.md guidelines. Check for N+1 queries, missing pagination, and unnecessary re-renders.

prompt_templates.title: Full comprehensive review
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct a full code review covering all dimensions: correctness, security, TypeScript quality, testing, performance, code quality, and architecture compliance. Use severity levels and provide templates for feedback.

best_practices: Always check security first before approving any PR
Use severity levels consistently to prioritize fixes
Provide specific file locations and actionable fix suggestions
Link TODOs to GitHub issues for follow-up
anti_patterns: Marking all issues as Low to avoid blocking merges
Leaving commented-out code or TODO without issue reference
Using any type instead of explicit TypeScript types

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Claude Code, and Codex for code review assistance.

faq.question: What severity levels should block merges?
faq.answer: Critical and High severity issues should be fixed before merge. Medium issues may merge with a plan.

faq.question: Does this integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Yes, it references security-sentinel, typescript-strict-guard, and architecture-patterns skills.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, this is a prompt-only skill. It does not access files or send data externally.

faq.question: Why are issues still being missed?
faq.answer: Reviews may lack consistent criteria. This skill standardizes the process with checklists.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters catch syntax and style issues. This skill catches logic, security, and architectural problems.
